paper.title: Clustering of financial time series in risky scenarios
paper.abstract: A methodology is presented for clustering financial time series according to the association in the tail of their distribution. The procedure is based on the calculation of suitable pairwise conditional Spearman's correlation coefficients extracted from the series. The performance of the method has been tested via a simulation study. As an illustration, an analysis of the components of the Italian FTSE-MIB is presented. The results could be applied to construct financial portfolios that can manage to reduce the risk in case of simultaneous large losses in several markets.

domain_result.justification: The paper presents a methodology for clustering financial time series based on tail associations, which is aimed at reducing risk in case of simultaneous large losses. This directly relates to financial risk management. Additionally, the results are suggested for constructing financial portfolios, which falls under portfolio management.
